Jeez... some people actually think that 1280x536 is not HD. It is.

With the common movie aspect ratio of 2.35:1 the actual picture's height can not be 720.
That would require a resolution of 1693x720.

up until about 0:06:20 h:mm:ss the audio skipped, but I couldn't tell any visual skipping.  now, at 0:06:20, it seems everything is running smooth, so try to skip there and see if you get the same resolve
the audio skipping seems to persist throughout the next ten minutes of the movie, possibly through the rest.  quite a shame since the video quality is a 11/10

I've found that, for some reason, the audio skips when playing this movie in VLC.  when playing this movie in QQ Player, someone mentioned earlier, the audio does not skip.  here's the catch: the QQ Player I've found is in a foreign language, a form of Chinese.  besides that the audio is fine
I would test WMP but my default install of it can't play the file lolwat

Anyone else with other player audio success, or a solution to the VLC's audio issue?

I have tried another player, Media Player Classic, and the audio does not skip.  I'm a big fan of VLC, and it hurt to leave it, but MPC seems alright.  the interface is clean, and if you have windows 7 (or possibly some sort of taskbar hack similar to), it shows movie progression/status on the taskbar, as if it were a download.  pretty cool feature

link to a massive codec pack that includes MPC:

I chose advanced install, but I'm pretty sure you can just as easily get away with simple install.  I changed very little in advanced
